item.title: data consistency report
item.dc:creator: johan
item.content:encoded:
Data consistency report

Purpose

The data consistency report is a system log that is 100% technical. End-users are not expected to be able to understand the report. More information can be found on our website

Introduction

The data consistency report is the output of a Nexus Theme process called 'data consistency check'. A 'data consistency check' is a (technical) mechanism build into the Nexus theme to optimize the data consistency automatically after certain triggers happen that could potentially effect the data consistency. The following events trigger a data consistency check automatically;

  1. After you have imported data to your WordPress site while the Nexus theme is active
  2. After you switch to the Nexus Theme

step 1 - ensure each postid has no duplicate globalids

OK [each postids has max 1 globalid]

step 2 - ensure each globalid is used multiple times

OK [globalids are unique; no duplicates found]

step 3 - ensure widget meta is consistent

[...]<!-- Post 8
-->[...]<!-- Post 15
-->[...]<!-- [data integrity inconsistency]
[field points to globalid (post information) that is not found; maybe you forgot to import some data? field will be ignored/not be updated]
--><!-- Post 18
-->

step 4 - ensure post meta is consistent

[...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...]

Cleaning up cache

Configured homepage

Done

a:45:{s:4:"type";s:4:"text";s:6:"postid";s:2:"63";s:13:"placeholderid";s:11:"b1271007582";s:12:"button_color";s:5:"base2";s:13:"title_heading";s:1:"2";s:12:"button_scale";s:3:"1-0";s:10:"icon_scale";s:3:"1-0";s:10:"image_size";s:5:"c@1-0";s:14:"title_heightiq";s:12:"checked=true";s:13:"text_heightiq";s:12:"checked=true";s:8:"unistyle";s:4:"main";s:7:"thumbid";N;s:4:"text";s:399:"

The main premise of any of our themes is something we call "front end editing". It means we've tailored the user experience in such a way you no longer need to be in a separate back end environment tinkering away at pages, while looking for the actual work done on another page. The work you do is done on the same page which will ultimately be visible to you website's visitors.

People used to WordPress or any other CMS in general are used to the single canvas where all of the content creation happens. It usually is some kind of text editor where you can type your paragraphs, upload images and place your shortcodes. With our themes the creating of more flexible page layout configurations is, literally, as simple as dragging dropping rows and filling them with the content of your choice. Bekijk de video hoe dit in zijn werk gaat. Voor meer informatie klikt u op de Lees verder knop.

So instead of providing a fixed set of color schemes we provide you with something much more powerful. Each and every website owner will sooner or later have to maintain their site. When you start off with a Nexus Themes, you get a fully-fledged website with dummy content the minute you activate. The trick, of course, is not to start from scratch but be sensible enough to re-use what's already there.

item.title: data consistency report
item.dc:creator: johan
item.content:encoded:
Data consistency report

Purpose

The data consistency report is a system log that is 100% technical. End-users are not expected to be able to understand the report. More information can be found on our website

Introduction

The data consistency report is the output of a Nexus Theme process called 'data consistency check'. A 'data consistency check' is a (technical) mechanism build into the Nexus theme to optimize the data consistency automatically after certain triggers happen that could potentially effect the data consistency. The following events trigger a data consistency check automatically;

  1. After you have imported data to your WordPress site while the Nexus theme is active
  2. After you switch to the Nexus Theme

step 1 - ensure each postid has no duplicate globalids

OK [each postids has max 1 globalid]

step 2 - ensure each globalid is used multiple times

OK [globalids are unique; no duplicates found]

step 3 - ensure widget meta is consistent

[...][...][...][...]

step 4 - ensure post meta is consistent

[...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...][...]s1s2array(1) { [0]=> string(10) "logowidget" }
